Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech, which is a fundamental right.
Government censorship could lead to a dystopian regime.
The public is capable of discerning misinformation without government intervention.
Government pressure on social media to censor content during the pandemic violated civil rights.
Censorship of certain medical professionals during the pandemic led to unnecessary deaths and injuries.
The proposed ACMA powers do not hold the government accountable under the same rules.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is a fundamental right that must not be watered down or removed.

The Australian population are intelligent enough to be able to listen to opinions and determine for themselves if those opinions are either correct or disinformation or misinformation without government interference.
It has become extremely clear that our government, many politicians and bureaucrats cannot be trusted to provide factual, honest and unbiased information to the Australian public.
